text: Cameron Toshiro Iwasa (born July 7, 1993) is an American soccer player who currently plays for Sacramento Republic in the USL Championship. ==Career== ===College and Amateur=== Iwasa spent his entire college career at UC Irvine. He made a total of 85 appearances for the anteaters and tallied 22 goals and 14 assists. He also played in the Premier Development League for OC Pateadores Blues. ===Professional=== On January 20, 2015, Iwasa was selected in the fourth round (65th overall) of the 2015 MLS SuperDraft by the Montreal Impact. However, he was cut during training camp. Two months later, he signed a professional contract with his hometown club Sacramento Republic FC. He made his professional debut the following day in a 4–2 defeat to Seattle Sounders FC 2. Iwasa signed with Major League Soccer side Sporting Kansas City on January 10, 2017. Iwasa returned to Sacramento Republic FC for the 2018 season on December 22, 2017. ==Personal life== Iwasa's grandfather is of Japanese descent. ==References== ==External links== *UC Irvine Anteaters bio Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:American people of Japanese descent Category:American soccer players Category:American sportspeople of Japanese descent Category:Association football forwards Category:Montreal Impact draft picks Category:OC Pateadores Blues players Category:Sacramento Republic FC players Category:Soccer players from California Category:Sporting Kansas City players Category:Sportspeople from Sacramento, California Category:Sporting Kansas City II players Category:UC Irvine Anteaters men's soccer players Category:USL Championship players Category:USL League Two players
title: Cameron Iwasa
